crypto.name: B4 the B8
crypto.desc: BB84 is pretty secure from what I've heard. I even told Bob to test for randomness as well...

crypto.name: Brutal Mogging
crypto.desc: I've been securitymaxxing lately so I increased the key size on my new encryption system. Only securitychads like me can crack it now. Good luck. ;)

crypto.name: Reader Exercise
crypto.desc: Kevin the sea cucumber became a math competition addict and developed this weird verification scheme. We could only recover this source file that's missing a function that looks pretty important. Before retreating back into his math competition preparation cave, he said that breaking this scheme would be left as "an exercise for the readers", so we now need your help to retrieve the flag!

crypto.name: Shuffling as a Service
crypto.desc: You'll be 'shuffed to bits after trying the Krusty Krab's new bit shuffling service™!

crypto.name: Third Times the Charm
crypto.desc: This didn't work the first two times.

forensic.name: Do Drivers of Torture Count
forensic.desc:
Impressed by your work so far, Mr. Krabs has come to you with another question. He thinks some of the files in his system aren't showing up anymore when he clicks thorugh his folders.

Was there anything Plankton did to the system that could have hidden files?

Note: It is recommended to play the challenge 'Meet my Wife' before playing this one

https://storage.googleapis.com/chal-static/forensics/umass-ctf-forensics.zip

forensic.name: Meet My Computer Wife Karen
forensic.desc:
Mr. Krabs has noticed some weird pop-ups on his computer recently, and he wants you to take a look. He's particularly worried because Plankton hasn't tried to steal the Krabby patty secret formula for a while. Has he found another way in?

https://storage.googleapis.com/chal-static/forensics/umass-ctf-forensics.zip

forensic.name: Victory Thy Name is Plankton
forensic.desc:
Mr. Krabs is very worried about the fact that you found malware on his computer.
He thinks Plankton might have been using the program to steal the Krabby Patty Secret Formula! Can you analyze the implant to figure out what commands Plankton sent to Mr. Krabs computer?

Note: It is recommended to play the challenge 'Meet my Wife' before playing this one

https://storage.googleapis.com/chal-static/forensics/umass-ctf-forensics.zip

misc.name: 100 Degrees
misc.desc: Mr. Krabs has been tinkering with the restaurant thermometer to see what makes his staff the most productive. He's been tracking the data in his journal, but some "Lagrange" guy just called saying Mr. Krabs already has all the info he needs. Can you help Mr. Krabs predict how his staff will fare?

misc.name: Agent P
misc.desc: Patrick sees secret, he puts it into computer immediately. But can you read the flag?

misc.name: Magic The Ungathering
misc.desc: I took 2 much red40 while watchmaxxing spongebob and I forgor to write a welcome challenge. Now all I can see is this image burned into my retinas. WHAT DOES IT MEAN!?! (There is a word in this image, wrap it in UMASS{} to get the flag. Example: if the word was ALLIGATOR the flag would be UMASS{ALLIGATOR})

misc.name: Stop the voices
misc.desc: Patrick’s been trying to remember the flag, but his vision seems a little blurry and the voices just don't stop...

pwn.name: Mitigations are Awesome
pwn.desc: Can you help me fix my code?

pwn.name: bench 225
pwn.desc: Life is one big tug of war. And you don't win the war by pushing the rope.

rev.name: Aspartame
rev.desc: Just because you can, doesn't mean you should.

rev.name: Free Delivery
rev.desc: Mr. Krabs has decided to make a new food delivery app for the Krusty Krab but Plankton decided to make his own patched version. Loyal Krusty Krab customers are saying weird network traffic and shell commands are coming from the app! Can you figure out what's going on?

rev.name: Fructose
rev.desc: Every once in a while, it is good to have fruit.

rev.name: Magic Conch
rev.desc: Come one, come all! For a limited time only, The Magic Conch is answering your most pressing queries! Fun and knowledge will collide as you learn the deepest secrets of the unvierse! If your queries are thought-provoking enough, The Magic Conch may even present you with the flag! (Please keep your queries to 32 bytes or less; The Magic Conch does not have the patience for yappers)

rev.name: Maltodextrin
rev.desc: Maltodextrin is popular; I wish this one can be popular too.

rev.name: Primitive Reversing
rev.desc: Plankton has forgotten his password. He asked Karen to encrypt it years ago, but only has the encrypted text left over. He managed to get his hands on the firmware's source, but it seems to be some ancient program he can't decipher...

rev.name: Primitive Reversing 2
rev.desc: After the first challenge, Plankton has learnt the esoteric language themselves and has whipped up this monstrosity...

rf.name: Red40 Maxxing
rf.desc: I picked up this signal coming from a Bikini Bottom computer, but I have no idea what it means. Can you help me demodulate it? (The signal has been shifted to baseband. The signal contains an english sentence repeated several times. Enter the key as UMASS{<some_sentence_here>}, where everything between the angle brackets has been replaced with the lowercase version of the sentence that was transmitted. Example if Hello_there was transmitted the key would be UMASS{hello_there}).

rf.name: Yellow5 Maxxing
rf.desc: I picked up another signal coming from a Bikini Bottom computer, but this time it is full of noise, it's spectrum is all spreadout. Can you help me demodulate it? (The signal has been shifted to baseband. The signal contains an english sentence repeated several times. Enter the key as UMASS{<some_sentence_here>}, where everything between the angle brackets has been replaced with the lowercase version of the sentence that was transmitted. Example if Hello_there was transmitted the key would be UMASS{hello_there}).

rf.name: Yellow6 Maxxing
rf.desc: I picked up this signal coming from a Bikini Bottom computer, except this one seems like it has twice as much information as the last one. Can you help me demodulate it?

web.name: Cash Cache
web.desc: Mr. Krabs has a new scheme to make money, the cash cache! However, he cheaped out on development by hiring Patrick so please make sure he did a good job!

web.name: Crabby Clicker
web.desc: I've created a new game called Crabby Clicker! It's a fun game where you click on a crab to get points. Once you get enough points, you can buy the flag!
